marketNews.title: US Economy Weakens, Trade War Sentiment Eases
marketNews.content: The US economy contracted by -0.3% annualized in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24: +2.4% annualized), according to the initial estimate from the US Bureau of Economic Analysis. This result is far lower than the consensus expectation which projected +0.3% annualized growth, simultaneously marking the first contraction since 1Q22. On an annual basis, the US economy still grew +2% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24: +2.5% YoY), but this marks the first growth slowdown since 4Q22. The weakening US economy in 1Q25 occurred alongside a surge in imports of +41.3% QoQ and +13.4% YoY, amid inventory building in anticipation of tariff hikes. On the other hand, trade war sentiment between the US and China began to ease. On Friday (2/5), the Chinese government stated it was evaluating the possibility of tariff negotiations with the US. Nevertheless, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce affirmed that it would only negotiate if the US first canceled tariffs on Chinese goods. Following the positive sentiment from the potential de-escalation of the trade war, the price of gold fell to the level of 3,260 US dollars per troy ounce on Friday (2/5), after reaching an all-time high of 3,423 US dollars per troy ounce on April 21, 2025. The US Dollar Index (DXY) also improved by +0.35% WoW to the level of 99.82 as of Friday (2/5), after briefly falling to its lowest level since March 2022 at 98.27 on April 21, 2025. In Indonesia itself, the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar strengthened by +2.35% WoW to the level of 16,435 on Friday (2/5), improving from its all-time low of 16,870 on April 24, 2025. On Friday (2/5), the IHSG also strengthened by +0.72% and the Indonesian government bond yield for the 10-year tenor fell about -5 bps to the level of 6.88%.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The prospects of trade negotiations between the US and China have the potential to make the US economic slowdown smoother than previously feared. This can provide positive sentiment for the general market (risk-on), especially emerging markets. Nevertheless, the potential flow shift (from the US market) will still depend on the growth prospects of the respective countries. Domestically, a more stable rupiah exchange rate can loosen the room for Bank Indonesia to cut the BI Rate to help boost economic growth.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. Consensus economists surveyed by Reuters expect Indonesia's economic growth to slow down to +4.91% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24 realization: +5.02% YoY). Quarterly, consensus economists estimate Indonesia's economy will contract -0.89% QoQ in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24 realization: +0.53% QoQ). This expectation is based on increasing uncertainty regarding global trade and low government spending in 1Q25. Indonesia's Q1 2025 economic growth data will only be released on May 5, 2025. 2. BPS noted that Indonesia's Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation rose to 1.95% YoY in April 2025 (vs. March 2025: 1.03% YoY inflation), marking the highest level since August 2024 following the Eid effect. Monthly, CPI inflation eased to 1.17% MoM (vs. March 2025: 1.65% MoM inflation). Core inflation rose to 2.5% YoY (vs. March 2025: 2.48% YoY inflation), marking the highest level in the last 22 months. 3. S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in April 2025 plummeted to the level of 46.7 (vs. March 2024: 52.4), marking the first contraction in factory activity in 6 months and the sharpest decline since August 2021. 4. The Ministry of Finance noted that the 2025 State Budget deficit as of 1Q25 reached 104.2 trillion rupiah or 0.43% of GDP. Nevertheless, the primary balance is still in a surplus of 17.5 trillion rupiah. The 2025 State Budget targets a deficit of 2.53% of GDP and a primary balance deficit of 63.3 trillion rupiah. 5. S&P Global noted that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in April 2025 fell to 50.4 (vs. March 2025: 51.2), but exceeded the consensus expectation of 49.8. This result marked the seventh consecutive month of expansion in factory activity, although it was the weakest growth since January 2025. This data indicates that the stimulus measures taken by the Chinese government still support the country's economic recovery. 6. The US Bureau of Labor Statistics noted that job vacancies in the US in March 2025 decreased by 288,000 to the level of 7.19 million (vs. February 2025: 7.48 million), below the consensus expectation of 7.48 million and marking the lowest level in the last 6 months. 7. Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) recorded net profit of 34 million US dollars in 1Q25 (+19% YoY, -5% QoQ). The annual increase in net profit was primarily driven by a decrease in net financing costs to 26 million US dollars (-8% YoY, -8% QoQ) from refinancing conducted in September 2024, as well as an exchange rate difference gain of 1 million US dollars (1Q24: loss 1 million US dollars, 4Q24: gain 2 million US dollars). Based on Stockbit calculations, BREN's EBITDA reached 126 million US dollars in 1Q25 (+3% YoY, -5% QoQ). 8. Advisor and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, told Reuters that the government plans to build 10 GW of nuclear power plants (PLTN). This plan is part of an addition of 103 GW of electricity capacity by 2040. Besides nuclear, this additional electricity capacity will come from 75 GW derived from solar, wind, geothermal, and biomass, and the remaining 18 GW will come from gas. Currently, Indonesia has a power generation capacity of 90 GW, with only 15 GW derived from renewable energy. 9. BPS noted that foreign tourist (wisman) arrivals in Indonesia reached approximately 841 thousand people in March 2025 (-2.2% YoY, -5.6% MoM). This result brought the total wisman arrivals to approximately 2.7 million people during 1Q25 (+7.8% YoY), equivalent to 17-20% of the government's 2025 target, which is in the range of 14-16 million people.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Acquires 40% of DATA for Rp974/Share
tickerNews.content: DATA: Remala Abadi announced that iForte Solusi Infotek, a subsidiary of Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR), has acquired 40% of the company's shares at a price of 974 rupiah per share or a total value of 535.7 billion rupiah. The acquisition price was -30% lower compared to DATA's stock price of 1,385 rupiah per share as of Friday (2/5). The shares were purchased from the previous controllers of DATA, namely Verah Wahyudi Singgih Wong and Jimmi Anka. After this transaction, TOWR through iForte becomes the controller of DATA and will carry out a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: SIDO's Net Profit Fell 40% YoY in 1Q25 to Rp233 Billion
tickerNews.content: SIDO: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul recorded net profit of 233 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-40% YoY, -41% QoQ), below expectations (20%/18% 2025F Stockbit estimate/consensus). The decline in net profit was primarily pressured by weak revenue, which also negatively impacted the company's margins. Revenue fell to 789 billion rupiah (-25% YoY, -39% QoQ), with core operating profit margin decreasing to 35% (vs. 1Q24: 46.7%, 4Q24: 39.1%).

tickerNews.title: ACES Net Profit Drops 31% YoY in 1Q25 Despite Revenue Growth Exceeding Guidance
tickerNews.content: ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded net profit of 142 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-31% YoY, -55% QoQ), below expectations as it represented 15% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~22%). Revenue grew annually to 2.1 trillion rupiah (+7% YoY, -9% QoQ), in line with expectations (23% 2025F consensus estimate) and exceeding the 2025 guidance from management which targeted +5% YoY revenue growth. Weak net profit was pressured by soaring opex-to-sales to 42.3% (+572 bps YoY, +833 bps QoQ) due to the Azko rebranding efforts. This surge caused the operating profit margin to drop to 9% (vs. 1Q24: 13.3%, 4Q24: 17.8%), resulting in operating profit reaching only 192 billion rupiah (-28% YoY, -54% QoQ) and below expectations as it represented 17% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~22%).

tickerNews.title: PWON's Net Profit Down 9% YoY in 1Q25, Pressured by Higher Opex and Other Expenses
tickerNews.content: PWON: Pakuwon Jati recorded net profit of 302 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-9% YoY, -27% QoQ), equivalent to 12% of the 2025F consensus estimate. Revenue increased slightly annually to 1.6 trillion rupiah (+2% YoY, -18% QoQ), supported by growth in recurring income (+10% YoY, -5% QoQ). Net profit was pressured by: 1) a decrease in operating profit margin to 41.5% (vs. 1Q24: 43.4%, 4Q24: 42.1%) due to an increase in opex (+12% YoY, -18% QoQ); and 2) an increase in other expenses (net) to 94 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: 19 billion rupiah, 4Q24: 44 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: SMRA Net Profit Dropped 46% YoY in 1Q25 Amid Flat Revenue and High Minority Interest
tickerNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded net profit of 238 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-46% YoY, -46% QoQ), equivalent to 21% of the 2025F consensus estimate. Net profit was pressured annually by an increase in opex amid flat revenue and high minority interest. Revenue was recorded at 2.1 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY, -32% QoQ) due to a decrease in revenue recognition in the property development segment (-8% YoY, -41% QoQ). The operating profit margin decreased to 29.9% (vs. 1Q24: 33.7%, 4Q24: 30.8%) due to an increase in opex to 436 billion rupiah (+14% YoY, -17% QoQ). Meanwhile, minority interest increased annually to 78 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: 4 billion rupiah, 4Q24: 149 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: JPFA Net Profit Slightly Below Expectations in 1Q25; Poultry Segment Margins Squeezed
tickerNews.content: JPFA: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia recorded a net profit of 680 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-26% QoQ, +2% YoY), slightly below expectations (23%/20% 2025F Stockbit estimate/consensus). The quarterly decline in net profit was mainly pressured by a decrease in operating profit to 1.1 trillion rupiah (-22% QoQ, +0% YoY), equivalent to 23%/21% 2025F Stockbit estimate/consensus. Operating profit in the poultry breeding/DOC segment (-23% QoQ), commercial farm/broiler segment (-72% QoQ), and poultry processing and consumer products segment (-20% QoQ) declined along with a decrease in the average price of DOC to 5,518 rupiah per chick (-10% QoQ) and broiler to 19,220 rupiah per kg (-5% QoQ). Meanwhile, the feed segment operating profit surged to 632 billion rupiah (+110% QoQ) amidst a slight increase in the average corn price to 4,852 rupiah per kg (+2% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: MAPI's 1Q25 Net Profit in Line with Expectations, Driven by MAPA Growth
tickerNews.content: MAPI: Mitra Adiperkasa recorded net profit of 472 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+14% YoY, +1% QoQ), in line with expectations as it represented 21% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~23%). Revenue grew annually (+6% YoY, -9% QoQ) and represented 22% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~22%). Operating profit also grew annually to 769 billion rupiah (+8% YoY, -28% QoQ), equivalent to 19% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. last 3 years: ~18%). Operating profit growth was mainly supported by MAP Aktif Adiperkasa (MAPA) which grew +16% YoY. Meanwhile, the fashion & digital segment operating profit grew +14% YoY, while the department stores segment grew +40% YoY. Conversely, the cafe & restaurant business segment saw a deterioration in losses to 62 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: loss 26 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: HEAL's 1Q25 Net Profit Declines 35% YoY Due to Margin Shrinkage and Higher Finance Costs
tickerNews.content: HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina recorded net profit of 125 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-35% YoY, +84% QoQ), equivalent to 20% of the 2025F consensus estimate. The decline in net profit was pressured by the contraction of the operating profit margin and an increase in finance costs. The operating profit margin decreased annually to 15.6% (vs. 1Q24: 19.5%, 4Q24: 11.4%) amid flat revenue at 1.7 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY, +0% QoQ). Finance costs increased to 49 billion rupiah (+75% YoY, +0% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: ERAL's 1Q25 Net Profit Grows 3% YoY Despite Opex Surge and JV Losses
tickerNews.content: ERAL: Sinar Eka Selaras recorded a net profit of 42 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+3% YoY, -5% QoQ), with revenue growing annually to 1.4 trillion rupiah (+26% YoY, -3% QoQ). Weak net profit growth was pressured by a surge in opex and losses in JV. Opex jumped to 172 billion rupiah (+74% YoY, +16% QoQ), causing opex-to-sales to rise to 12.5% (vs. 1Q24: 9.1%, 4Q25: 10.5%). Meanwhile, losses in JV reached 3 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: profit 4 billion rupiah, 4Q24: profit 2 billion rupiah) following the full consolidation of JD Sports which was acquired in November 2024. On the positive side, gross profit margin grew to 16.4% (+387 bps YoY, +293 bps QoQ), driven by an increased revenue mix from the fashion apparel segment - with a gross profit margin of 22.7% - which now accounts for 23% of total revenue (vs. 1Q24: 3%, 4Q24: 12%), causing the operating profit margin to remain stable annually at 4.2% (+9 bps YoY, +44 bps QoQ). Operating profit grew to 58 billion rupiah (+28% YoY, +9% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: BRIS Net Profit Rose 10% YoY in 1Q25, Supported by Fee Based Income Growth
tickerNews.content: BRIS: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah in 1Q25 (+10% YoY, -1% QoQ), relatively in line with expectations (23% 2025F consensus estimate). The increase in net profit was mainly supported by the growth in fee based income to 1.7 trillion rupiah (+39% YoY, +1.6% QoQ). On the top-line side, Net Margin Income (NMI) grew +6.7% YoY, supported by financing growth of +16.2% YoY (vs. 4Q24: +15.9% YoY, 1Q24: +15.9% YoY) which is relatively in line with the 2025 guidance from management in the range of +14-16% YoY. Margin pressure, which is seen in the NMI growth not being as high as financing growth, is also reflected in the Net Return Ratio (NI) which fell to 5.31% (vs. 1Q24: 5.38%, 2024: 5.66%), below the 2025 guidance targeting a range of 5.5-5.9%. In terms of asset quality, credit cost (CoC) slightly increased to 0.93% (vs. 1Q24: 0.88%, 2024: 0.83%) and is still in line with the 2025 guidance targeting below 1%.

tickerNews.title: MAIN's 1Q25 Net Profit Fell 28% YoY, DOC and Broiler Segments Deteriorated QoQ
tickerNews.content: MAIN: Malindo Feedmill recorded a net profit of 63 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-51% QoQ, -28% YoY), with operating profit decreasing to 159 billion rupiah (-7% QoQ, -32% YoY). The quarterly decline in net profit was mainly pressured by a loss in the DOC segment amounting to 41 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q24: profit 54 billion rupiah), amid a decrease in the average DOC price to 5,518 rupiah per chick (-10% QoQ). The decline in operating profit also occurred in the broiler segment, which recorded an operating profit of 2 billion rupiah (-93% QoQ) along with a decrease in the average broiler price to 19,220 rupiah per kg (-5% QoQ). Meanwhile, the feed segment posted an increase in operating profit to 145 billion rupiah (+13% QoQ), driven by an increase in the average corn price to 4,852 rupiah per kg (+2% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: BREN's 1Q25 Net Profit Grew 19% YoY, Supported by Lower Net Finance Costs
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) recorded net profit of 34 million US dollars in 1Q25 (+19% YoY, -5% QoQ). The annual increase in net profit was primarily driven by a decrease in net financing costs to 26 million US dollars (-8% YoY, -8% QoQ) from refinancing conducted in September 2024, as well as an exchange rate difference gain of 1 million US dollars (1Q24: loss 1 million US dollars, 4Q24: gain 2 million US dollars). Based on Stockbit calculations, BREN's EBITDA reached 126 million US dollars in 1Q25 (+3% YoY, -5% QoQ).
